etymologies: mid 17th century: from Greek parenkhuma ‘something poured in besides’, from para- ‘beside’ + enkhuma ‘infusion’

definitions: the functional tissue of an organ as distinguished from the connective and supporting tissue
shortDefinitions: functional tissue of organ as distinguished from connective

definitions: the cellular tissue, typically soft and succulent, found chiefly in the softer parts of leaves, pulp of fruits, bark and pith of stems, etc.
shortDefinitions: cellular tissue found in softer parts of leaves, pulp of fruits, bark and pith of stems

definitions: cellular tissue lying between the body wall and the organs of invertebrate animals lacking a coelom, such as flatworms.
shortDefinitions: cellular tissue lying between body wall and organs of invertebrate animals lacking coelom
